data.title: Top 25 Male Celebrities with Long Hair
data.meta_description: There are plenty of male celebrities with long hair. Find out more by reading our top 25 list of the most notable celebs with long locks!
data.text:
Long hair has always been a symbol of rebellion, freedom, and individuality.

Many male celebrities have sported long locks over the years, defying societal norms and setting new trends.

From rockstars to actors, the long-haired male celebrity has become an iconic figure in popular culture.

While many celebrities opt for shorter hairstyles, there are still a few who choose to stand out from the crowd.

In this article, we’ll take a closer look at some of the most famous male celebrities with long hair.

From Jason Momoa to Harry Styles, these celebrities have shown that long hair can be a powerful tool for self-expression and creativity.

1. Harry Styles long hair

Harry Styles rose to fame as a member of the boy band One Direction, and since then has become a successful solo artist.

His hair has gone through various stages, from shoulder-length curls to a more tousled, messy look.

He has been seen wearing his hair in a variety of styles, including long hairstyles.

Styles has continued to embrace long hair until he recently switched to shorter hair. But his fans continue to love and admire him regardless of his hairstyle choices.

2. Chris Hemsworth long hair

Chris Hemsworth is an Australian actor who is best known for his portrayal of Thor in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

In the first Thor film, Hemsworth had long curls styled in a wavy, voluminous manner. As the films progressed, his was often braided or tied back into a ponytail.

Hemsworth has also sported long hair in other roles throughout his acting career, such as in the historical drama film “In the Heart of the Sea.”

In this film, he played a sailor and his hair was styled in a more unkempt and natural way, with a slight wave and some texture.

Whether he’s playing a superhero or a historical figure, Hemsworth has shown that he’s not afraid to experiment with his hair and embrace new looks.

3. Keanu Reeves long hair

Keanu Reeves is a Canadian actor, producer, and musician who has been in the entertainment industry for several decades.

Throughout his career, he has experimented with different hairstyles, including long hair.

Reeves prefers to grow out his hair to about neck length with a distinct middle part and curtain bangs.

Throughout his career, Reeves’ long hair has provided him with a rugged and masculine look.

4. Tom Cruise long hair

Tom Cruise is an American actor and producer who has been in the entertainment industry for several decades.

One of Cruise’s most famous long-hair looks was in the 1980s film “Top Gun.”

In this movie, he played the character Pete “Maverick” Mitchell and his hair was styled in a classic, slicked-back 80s style.

Thanks to his long locks and irresistible charm, he has become one of the most beloved actors of all time.

5. Timothée Chalamet long hair

Timothée Chalamet is a French-American actor who is known for his talent, unique sense of style, and distinctive hair.

Chalamet has sported long hair in other roles and off-screen.

He has been seen with his hair styled in various ways, including slicked back, pulled back into a bun, or left loose and tousled.

Long hair suits him well, and his signature long hair has cemented him as both an amazing actor and a fashion icon.

6. Brad Pitt long hair

Brad Pitt is an American actor and producer who has been in the entertainment industry for several decades.

Pitt’s long hairstyle looked absolutely stunning back in the day.

In fact, he is among the few male celebs who only seem to get more handsome as the years go by.

7. Orlando Bloom long hair

Orlando Bloom is an English actor who is known for his roles in films such as “Pirates of the Caribbean” and “The Lord of the Rings.”

One of Bloom’s most famous long-hair looks was in the “Pirates of the Caribbean” film series.

In these movies, he played the character Will Turner and his hair was styled in a natural, flowing, and wavy manner that perfectly suited his character.

8. Johnny Depp long hair

Johnny Depp is an American actor and musician who is known for his unique sense of style and distinctive hair.

One of Depp’s most famous long-hair looks was in the “Pirates of the Caribbean” film series.

In these movies, he played the character Jack Sparrow and his hair was styled in a natural, flowing, and slightly messy manner.

It’s hard to say how much effort went into the creation of this look, but it was certainly worth it.

Despite his recent controversies, his longer locks still make him look as good as ever.

9. David Beckham long hair

David Beckham is an English former professional footballer who is known for his distinctive style, wavy hair, and immaculate fashion sense.

One of Beckham’s most famous long-hair looks was in the early 2000s when he played for Manchester United and the English national team.

In this period, his hair was styled in a natural, flowing, and layered manner.

Beckham’s long hair has been a subject of discussion among his fans and the media, with many praising his handsome and fashionable look.

His hair has even been the inspiration for various trends, such as the “David Beckham haircut.”

10. Hugh Jackman long hair

Hugh Jackman is an Australian actor and producer who has been a fan favourite for many decades.

Jackman has sported long hair in many different roles, including X-men. He’s always been a perfect example of masculinity and style.

11. Jared Leto long hair

Jared Leto is an American actor, musician, and director who is known for his unique style and outstanding musical performances.

One of Leto’s most famous long-hair looks was in the mid-2010s when he was performing with his band, Thirty Seconds to Mars.

In this period, his hair was styled in a long and natural layered manner that perfectly suited his artistic personality.

12. Christian Bale long hair

One of his most famous long-hair looks was in the film “American Hustle,” where he played the character Irving Rosenfeld.

In this movie, his hair was styled in a 1970s-inspired comb-over with long, curly locks on the sides and back of his head.

Bale’s long hair in “American Hustle” was a significant departure from his typically short hair, and it helped to transform him into his character.

The hairstyle added an extra layer of authenticity to the film’s setting and helped to define the character’s personality.

13. Jake Gyllenhaal long hair

Jake Gyllenhaal is an American actor known for his chiselled good looks and his ability to transform into diverse roles.

One of Gyllenhaal’s most famous long-hair looks was in the film “Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time.”

In this movie, he played the character Dastan and his hair was styled in a flowing, shoulder-length mane.

Gyllenhaal’s long hair has been a subject of discussion among his fans and the media, with many praising his handsome bad-boy look.

14. Ashton Kutcher long hair

Ashton Kutcher is an American actor and model who has experimented with various hairstyles throughout his career.

In the early 2000s, he was known for his long hair, which was styled in a shaggy, layered look that perfectly suited his laid-back personality.

Kutcher’s long hair was a signature part of his image during his time on the popular television show “That 70s Show.”

15. Jason Momoa

Jason Momoa is an American actor, writer, director, and producer who is known for his thick beard and striking appearance.

Momoa’s long hair is often styled in a loose, beachy wave that perfectly complements his looks.

Momoa’s long hair was first introduced to audiences during his breakout role as Khal Drogo in the hit television series “Game of Thrones.”

In this role, his long hair was styled in braids, which added to his character’s fierce and intimidating personality.

16. Daniel Radcliffe

Daniel Radcliffe is an English actor best known for his role as Harry Potter in the popular film franchise.

While he has experimented with different hairstyles throughout his career, he has rarely been seen with long hair.

There was a time in Radcliffe’s career when he grew his hair out to shoulder length.

He did this for his role in the 2013 film “Kill Your Darlings,” in which he played the poet Allen Ginsberg.

While Radcliffe’s long hair was a departure from his usual short hair which suits the star perfectly.

Since then, Radcliffe has returned to his usual short hairstyle.

17. Tom Brady

Tom Brady is an American football player who is known for his athletic abilities, as well as his sense of style.

While he has sported a variety of haircuts throughout his career, he is perhaps best known for his classic, clean-cut style.

In his early years in the NFL, Brady typically wore his hair in a short, spiky style.

However, in recent years, he has experimented with longer hairstyles, often wearing his hair in a slicked-back style that is longer on top.

Whether he’s wearing his hair short and spiky or long and slicked back, Brady’s sense of style is always on point.

18. Zayn Malik

Zayn Malik is an English singer and songwriter who has experimented with a variety of hairstyles throughout his career.

One of his most iconic looks was when he had long hair, which he wore in a variety of styles.

During his time in the boy band One Direction, Malik’s hair was often styled in a classic, swept-over style.

However, after he left the band to pursue a solo career, he began experimenting with longer hair.

Malik’s long hair was often styled in a sleek, straight style that perfectly complemented his edgy and fashion-forward look.

He was also known to wear his hair in a messy, textured style, which added to his rocker aesthetic.

19. Bo Burnham

Bo Burnham is an American comedian, musician, and filmmaker who is known for his unique sense of humour and artistic vision.

He has experimented with a variety of hairstyles throughout his career but is perhaps best known for his long hair, which he grew out of during his early years in the entertainment industry.

Bo Burnham was also known to wear his hair in a ponytail, which gave him a more polished and put-together appearance.

He has shown that he’s not afraid to take risks and try new things, which has helped him to develop a loyal following of fans who appreciate his unique style and sensibility.

20. Kit Harrington

Kit Harington is an English actor who is best known for his role as Jon Snow on “Game of Thrones”.

Throughout his time on the show, Harington’s character was known for his long, curly hair, which became something of a signature look for the actor.

Harington’s long hair was often styled in loose, natural curls that perfectly complemented his style.

In real life was also known to wear his hair in a man bun which gave him a more polished and refined look.

Harington’s long hair was met with praise from fans and the media, with many citing it as one of the most iconic looks on “Game of Thrones.”

While he has since cut his hair shorter, Harington’s experimentation with long hair helped to establish him as a distinctive figure.

21. Russell Brand

Russell Brand is an English comedian, actor, and radio host who is known for his quirky personality and irreverent sense of humour. He is perhaps best known for his long, curly hair.

Brand’s long hair was often styled in wild, unruly curls that perfectly complemented his unconventional and nonconformist personality.

His unique look helped him to establish himself as a distinctive and memorable figure in the world of comedy and entertainment.

22. Joaquin Phoenix

Joaquin Phoenix is an American actor and producer who is known for his intense and versatile performances on screen.

Phoenix’s long hair was often styled in a natural and tousled look, with his wavy locks cascading over his shoulders.

His hair has become something of a trademark for the actor, who has used his distinctive appearance to great effect in many of his roles.

23. Adam Driver

Adam Driver is an American actor known for his commanding presence on screen and his distinctive physical features.

He has also been known to wear his hair in a sleek, pulled-back style, which gives him a more refined appearance.

His long hair has helped to establish him as a unique and memorable figure in the world of film.

Adam Driver’s long hair is just one of many distinctive features that have helped to make him one of the most compelling and dynamic actors of his generation.

24. Shia LaBeouf

Shia LaBeouf is an American actor and filmmaker who has been in the public eye since he was a child.

Over the years, LaBeouf has experimented with a variety of hairstyles, ranging from short and spiky to long and shaggy.

One of LaBeouf’s most notable haircuts was his long and messy style, which he sported during the mid-2000s.

This look was characterized by his long hair that fell in loose, tousled waves around his face, giving him an edgy appearance.

Despite his ever-changing haircuts, LaBeouf’s unique and unconventional style has helped to establish him as one of the most memorable and dynamic actors of his generation.

25. Jason Lee

Jason Lee is an American actor and former professional skateboarder. He is known for his distinctive features, including his tall stature, square jawline, and striking dark brown eyes.

During the 1990s and early 2000s, Lee’s long hair was characterized by his messy, shaggy locks. His hair fell in loose waves around his face and down his back.
